flashcards.english: Near Future (-kũ-) = later today: Atumia nĩ mekũ-uga mbu (Women will make distress sound), Wee nĩ ũkũ-huha mĩruri (You will whistle). Distant Future (-ka-) = tomorrow/later: Atumia nĩ makã-uga mbu, Wee nĩ ũka-huha mĩruri
flashcards.notes: Two future tense markers: -kũ- (near future/later today) vs -ka- (distant future/tomorrow or later). Pattern applies to all verbs. Examples: ikũ-gamba → ika-gamba (will crow), tũkũ-ina → tũka-ina (will sing)

examples.english: We will sing a nice song (tomorrow)

flashcards.english: Kaĩ = question prefix. Adding 'ĩ' at end = emphatic statement. Examples: Kwĩna heho (It is cold) → Kaĩ kwĩna heho? (Is it cold?) → Kaĩ kwĩna heho-ĩ! (It is really cold!)
flashcards.notes: Kaĩ prefix turns statements into questions. Adding final 'ĩ' cancels the question back to emphatic statement. Pattern: Statement → Kaĩ + statement? (question) → Kaĩ + statement + ĩ! (emphatic)
